intro: Machaerina effusa, commonly known as the coastal flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in coastal areas, thriving in sandy or gravelly soils. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish-white flowers. Machaerina effusa is often used in traditional Māori medicine for its purported healing properties.
